perturbation.original_text: FRANCHISEE ACKNOWLEDGES AND AGREES THAT PRETZEL TIME HAS THE RIGHT TO PLACE UNITS AT ANY LOCATION, EXCEPT AS LIMITED BY THIS AGREEMENT, AT ITS SOLE DISCRETION AND WITHOUT REGARD TO THE IMPACT UPON THE FRANCHISEE'S BUSINESS. FRANCHISEE ACKNOWLEDGES THAT ABSENT A SEPARATE AREA DEVELOPER'S AGREEMENT, PRETZEL TIME HAS THE RIGHT TO PLACE UNITS AT ANY LOCATION, AT ITS SOLE DISCRETION, AND WITHOUT REGARD TO THE IMPACT UPON THE FRANCHISEE'S BUSINESS.
perturbation.changed_text: FRANCHISEE ACKNOWLEDGES AND AGREES THAT PRETZEL TIME shall seek to place units with consideration of the Franchisee's business, EXCEPT AS LIMITED BY THIS AGREEMENT, AT ITS SOLE DISCRETION AND WITH REGARD TO THE IMPACT UPON THE FRANCHISEE'S BUSINESS. FRANCHISEE ACKNOWLEDGES THAT ABSENT A SEPARATE AREA DEVELOPER'S AGREEMENT, PRETZEL TIME shall seek to place units with consideration of the Franchisee's business at ANY LOCATION, AT ITS SOLE DISCRETION, AND WITH REGARD TO THE IMPACT UPON THE FRANCHISEE'S BUSINESS.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'HAS THE RIGHT TO PLACE UNITS...WITHOUT REGARD' to 'shall seek to place units WITH REGARD,' the contract now presents a contradictory commitment. Initially, it asserts Pretzel Time's freedom to place units without considering impact, but then suggests a requirement to consider the Franchisee's business, creating conflict. This introduces ambiguity that is likely to be difficult to be legally enforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Enforceability, Franchise Law - Good Faith

perturbation.original_text:
4.C. ROYALTY FEE.

         Franchisee,  in  partial  consideration  of the  grant of a  franchise, agrees to pay to Pretzel  Time a  continuing  Royalty of seven  percent  (7%) of Franchisee's  net  revenues  (as  defined  in  Section  1) on a weekly  basis as specified in this  Section;  provided  only 4% Royalty  shall be payable on TCBY frozen yogurt and other TCBY frozen yogurt products.  The Royalty is not uniform as to  all  franchisees,  it is  fully  earned,  and  is  nonrefundable  in  any circumstance.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.C. ROYALTY FEE.

         Franchisee,  in  partial  consideration  of the  grant of a  franchise, agrees to pay to Pretzel  Time a  continuing  Royalty of seven  percent  (7%) of Franchisee's  net  revenues  (as  defined  in  Section  1) on a weekly  basis as specified in this  Section;  provided  only 4% Royalty  shall be payable on TCBY frozen yogurt and other TCBY frozen yogurt products.  The Royalty is uniform as to  all  franchisees,  it is  fully  earned,  and  is  nonrefundable  in  any circumstance.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'The Royalty is not uniform as to all franchisees' and stating 'The Royalty is uniform as to all franchisees,' this change introduces a legal contradiction. The original text acknowledges that royalty fees may vary, while the changed text asserts uniformity. This contradiction makes the royalty clause ambiguous and potentially unenforceable, as it misrepresents the financial obligations of the franchisee.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Franchise Law - Disclosure Requirements, Contract Law - Misrepresentation

perturbation.original_text: Franchisee agrees to use in developing and operating the Unit only such fixtures,  furnishings,  equipment, and signs that Pretzel Time requires and has approved for Pretzel Time Units as meeting its  specifications and standards for quality, design, appearance, function and performance. Franchisee further agrees to place or display at the Unit only such signs, emblems,  lettering,  logos and display  materials  that  Pretzel  Time  approves in writing  from time to time; provided,  however,  that  Pretzel  Time  shall  have  the  right,  in its  sole discretion,  to install  all  required  signs at the Unit at  Franchisee's  sole expense.
perturbation.changed_text: Franchisee agrees to use in developing and operating the Unit only such fixtures,  furnishings,  equipment, and signs that Pretzel Time requires and has approved for Pretzel Time Units as meeting its  specifications and standards for quality, design, appearance, function and performance. Franchisee further agrees to place or display at the Unit only such signs, emblems,  lettering,  logos and display  materials  that  Pretzel  Time and Franchisee approves in writing  from time to time; provided,  however,  that  Pretzel  Time  shall negotiate with Franchisee to install  all  required  signs at the Unit at mutually agreed upon expense.
perturbation.explanation: Initially, Pretzel Time has the unilateral right to install all required signs at the Franchisee's sole expense. By restructuring to now require both Pretzel Time and Franchisee to approve the signs and 'mutually agreed upon expense,' the change contradicts the original's clearly defined rights and responsibilities, introducing uncertainty. This affects enforcement of the signs' installation clause, as the unilateral control of Pretzel Time is lost.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Duty of Good Faith, Franchise Law - Contractual Obligations
